newsitem.title: MONGOLIA: Mongolia plans first land auction next week.
newsitem.headline: Mongolia plans first land auction next week.

text.p: Mongolia will hold its first land auction next week, starting with three small sites in the capital, Ulan Bator, the Auction Commission said on Friday.
The sites, ranging from just 140 to 240 sq metres (1,505 sq ft to 2,580 sq ft), and designated for commercial construction, will be auctioned on May 30.
"Auctioning land is a new thing and starts from Ulan Bator," the commission spokesman said in an interview. "Any registered resident in Mongolia may participate."
A minimum price of between 234,750 and 240,750 tugriks ($298 to $306) has been set, although the actual price is expected to be much higher.
The commission official said other sites would be auctioned in future though he gave no details.
Natsagiin Bagabandi, candidate of the former communist party, upset reformist President Punsalmaagiin Ochirbat in presidential elections on Sunday.
Some Western diplomats have expressed concern that the new president might slow the pace of Mongolia's market style reforms, particularly in its plans for privatisation.
